places.name: Hong Kong Disneyland
places.description: Hong Kong Disneyland is a theme park located on reclaimed land in Penny's Bay, Lantau Island. It is located inside the Hong Kong Disneyland Resort and it is owned and managed by Hong Kong International Theme Parks.

places.name: Hong Kong Museum of Coastal Defence
places.address: 175 Tung Hei Road. Shau Kei Wan, Hong Kong
places.description: The Hong Kong Museum of Coastal Defence is a museum in Hong Kong, located in a former coastal defence fort overlooking the Lei Yue Mun channel, near Shau Kei Wan on Hong Kong Island.

places.name: 1881 Heritage
places.description: The Former Marine Police Headquarters Compound, constructed in 1884, is located in Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong. The site is now officially renamed as 1881 Heritage.

places.name: Nan Lian Garden
places.description: The Nan Lian Garden is a Chinese Classical Garden in Diamond Hill, Hong Kong. The garden has an area of 3.5 hectares. It is designed in the Tang Dynasty-style with hills, water features, trees, rocks and wooden structures.

places.name: Hong Kong Maritime Museum
places.address: Central Ferry Pier No. 8 ,Man Kwong Street, Central
places.description: Hong Kong Maritime Museum is a non-profit educational institution funded by the international shipping community and the government in Hong Kong. It is located at Central Pier 8, Hong Kong. The museum was reopened to the public in February 2013.

places.name: Hong Kong International Airport
places.address: 1 Sky Plaza Rd, Chek Lap Kok
places.description: Hong Kong International Airport is the main airport in Hong Kong. It is located on the island of Chek Lap Kok, which largely comprises land reclaimed for the construction of the airport itself.

places.name: Golden Bauhinia Square
places.description: The Golden Bauhinia Square is an open area in Wan Chai, Hong Kong. The square was named after the giant statue of a golden Bauhinia blakeana at the centre of the area, situated outside the Hong Kong

places.name: Peak Tower
places.description: The Peak Tower is a leisure and shopping complex located at Victoria Gap, near the summit of Victoria Peak on Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong. It also houses the upper terminal of the Peak Tram.

places.name: Stanley Market
places.address: Stanley New Street and Stanley Market Road, Stanley, Hong Kong Island
places.description: Stanley Market is a street market in Stanley on Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong. The street is a typical example of a traditional old open-air market in Hong Kong and has since become a major tourist attraction, well known for its bargains.

places.name: Peak Tram
places.description: Victorian-era train taking visitors to the highest peak on Hong Kong island for views of the city.

places.name: Times Square
places.description: Times Square is a major shopping centre and office tower complex in Causeway Bay, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong. The complex, owned by Wharf Properties Limited, part of The Wharf Limited group, was opened in April 1994.

places.name: Po Lin (Precious Lotus) Monastery
places.description: Po Lin Monastery is a Buddhist monastery, located on Ngong Ping Plateau, on Lantau Island, Hong Kong.

places.name: Kai Tak Cruise Terminal Park
places.description: The Kai Tak Cruise Terminal Park is located at the flat roof of the Kai Tak Cruise Terminal Building at 33 Shing Fung Road, Kai Tak, Kowloon. The Park occupies an area of 23,000 square metres with passive amenities including a central lawn, a viewing platform, water garden, fountain plaza, etc.

places.name: Lan Kwai Fong
places.description: Lan Kwai Fong is a small square of streets in Central, Hong Kong. The area was dedicated to hawkers before the Second World War, but underwent a renaissance in the mid-1980s.

places.name: Mai Po Nature Reserve
places.description: Mai Po Marshes is a nature reserve located near Yuen Long in Hong Kong. It is part of Deep Bay, an internationally significant wetland that is actually a shallow estuary, at the mouths of Sham Chun River, Shan Pui River and Tin Shui Wai Nullah.

places.name: Hong Kong Gold Coast Piazza
places.address: 1 Castle Peak Road (Castle Peak Bay), So Kwun Wat
places.description: Hong Kong Gold Coast (Chinese: 香港黃金海岸) is a private housing estate served by Castle Peak Road, near Castle Peak Bay, in So Kwun Wat, Tuen Mun, New Territories, Hong Kong. Developed by Sino Group, it includes 20 residential buildings completed in two phases (in 1990 and 1993 respectively), a resort hotel, a shopping mall, a yacht and country club, a marina and a beach.

places.name: Hong Kong Museum of History
places.address: 100 Chatham Road South, Tsim Sha Tsui
places.description: The Hong Kong Museum of History is a museum which preserves Hong Kong's historical and cultural heritage. It is located next to the Hong Kong Science Museum, in Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong.

places.name: Hong Kong Museum of Art
places.description: Hong Kong's main art museum, featuring mostly Chinese paintings, sculptures & drawings.

places.name: Hong Kong Science Museum
places.address: Number 2, Science Museum Rd, Tsim Sha Tsui East
places.description: The Hong Kong Science Museum is a science museum in Tsim Sha Tsui East, Kowloon, Hong Kong, located next to the Hong Kong Museum of History.

places.name: Noahs Ark Hotel and Resort
places.description: Part of the Noah's Ark theme park, this modern hotel next to Ma Wan Tung Wan Beach is 2 km from Park Island Pier for services to Hong Kong Island and the New Territories.Modest rooms with animal-themed decor come with flat-screen TVs and complimentary Wi-Fi, plus minifridges and tea and coffeemakers. Family rooms add bunk beds; some have balconies or terraces. Kids age 11 and under stay at no charge in their parents' room.Breakfast, served in a relaxed restaurant, and park tickets are included. There's also a diner-style eatery and a cafe. Other amenities include a hot tub, beach access, botanical gardens and a heritage centre.

places.name: The Kowloon Hotel
places.description: On the lively shopping street, Nathan Road, and 500 m from the harbour, this upscale hotel is a 4-minute walk from the East Tsim Sha Tsui subway station.Compact, elegant rooms offer city views, as well as flat-screen TVs and free Wi-Fi. They also have tea and coffeemaking facilities. Upgraded rooms add minibars, and some offer harbour views and/or separate living areas. Club rooms add lounge access. Room service is available.A free breakfast buffet is served in a modern eatery with street views. There's a cafe, a bar and a refined dim sum restaurant. A gym, a sauna and an indoor pool cost extra.

places.name: The Peninsula Hong Kong
places.description: Overlooking Victoria Harbor, this regal hotel, built in 1928, is a 5-minute walk from the Avenue of Stars waterfront promenade and 3 minutes' walk from the Hong Kong Space Museum.Airy rooms with city views feature free Wi-Fi and flat-screen TVs. Posh, upgraded rooms add floor-to-ceiling windows with harbor views. Polished suites have separate living areas and walk-in closets, while lavish, upgraded suites add bathtubs and fireplaces; some include use of a chauffeur-driven Rolls-Royce.There are 7 restaurants, including French, Swiss and Asian options. Other amenities include a bar, posh spa, a gym, and an indoor pool with city views.

places.name: Dorsett Mongkok, Hong Kong
places.address: 88 Tai Kok Tsui Road, Tai Kok Tsui
places.description: A 7-minute walk from a metro station, this relaxed hotel with a glass facade is 2 km from Victoria Harbour and 4 km from Hong Kong Cultural Centre.The airy rooms feature free Wi-Fi and flat-screen TVs, as well as iPod docks, minifridges, and tea and coffeemaking facilities. Upgraded rooms add city views and club lounge access. Suites have separate dining areas, and living rooms with sofabeds. Room service is offered.An area shuttle is free. There's a chic Thai restaurant with outdoor seating.

places.name: Panda Hotel
places.description: This choice hotel is a 10-minute walk from the nearest transit station and 15 km from Hong Kong Disneyland.Featuring contemporary decor, the vibrant rooms and suites offer Wi-Fi (fee), flat-screen TVs and sofas, plus tea and coffeemaking facilities, safes, and iPod docks. Airy, individually themed suites add plush sofas; 1 has a whirlpool tub in the living room, while another adds a kitchenette.A breakfast buffet is served in a colourful cafe (fee). Dining options include a ritzy restaurant and an elegant Asian eatery, plus a sports bar. There's event space, and an outdoor pool with cabanas.

places.name: Best Western Hotel Harbour View
places.address: 239 Queen's Road West, Sai Ying Pun
places.description: In a high-rise on Hong Kong Island overlooking Victoria Harbour, this straightforward hotel is a minute by foot from a metro stop and 2 km from the Peak Tram terminal.Bright, airy rooms feature flat-screen TVs, free Wi-Fi and safes, as well as minifridges, and tea and coffeemaking facilities. All come with mountain, city or harbour views. Room service is offered.There's a rooftop outdoor pool, an exercise room and a business centre, as well as a casual restaurant with a terrace offering international dining.

places.name: Kimberley Hotel
places.description: Set in the vibrant Tsim Sha Tsui neighbourhood, this elegant hotel in a high-rise building is a 4-minute walk from Hong Kong Observatory, a 6-minute walk from Tsim Sha Tsui metro station and 1 km from Victoria Harbour.The straightforward rooms come with free Wi-Fi, minibars and flat-screens, along with tea and coffeemaking facilities. Suites feature separate bedrooms and living rooms with sofabeds. There’s room service.Amenities include a Chinese restaurant, a Japanese restaurant and a coffee shop, as well as a cosy bar, an exercise room and a spa area with an indoor pool and a hot tub. Meeting facilities and parking (fee) are available.

places.name: Rambler Hotel
places.description: On Tsing Yi island overlooking the Rambler Channel, this casual high-rise hotel with a sleek facade is 3 km from Kwai Fong Metroplaza shopping mall, 7 km from the iconic Victoria Harbour and 26 km from Hong Kong International Airport. The 800 streamlined rooms have colourful accents, and come with Wi-Fi access and satellite TV, plus minifridges, and tea and coffeemaking facilities. Upgraded rooms add views of the channel or harbour.Amenities include a seasonal outdoor pool, a gym and a 35,000-sq-ft rooftop garden. Minimum-stay rules may apply.

places.name: BP International
places.address: No. 8 Austin Road, Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong Scout Centre & Fort Dragon International
places.description: In a sleek high-rise with a grand lobby, this relaxed hotel is 3 minutes' walk from a subway station, 9 minutes on foot from Kowloon Park and 1 km from Victoria Harbour.Understated rooms feature city, harbour or park views. All have free Wi-Fi, flat-screens and minifridges, as well as tea and coffeemaking facilities. Upgraded rooms add minibars and iPod docks; some have sitting areas. Family quarters come with bunk beds, while cosy suites include living rooms.A breakfast buffet (fee) is served in an informal international restaurant. There's a warm, airy bar with regular live music.
